TITLE: Defining Field Changes in OpenUpgrade for Base Module
DESCRIPTION: This extensive snippet details the changes to fields in various models within the 'base' module, including new fields, deleted fields, and modifications to existing fields.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/base/17.0.1.3/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
---Fields in module 'base'---
base         / ir.actions.act_url       / target (selection)            : selection_keys is now '['download', 'new', 'self']' ('['new', 'self']')
base         / ir.actions.act_window    / mobile_view_mode (char)       : NEW hasdefault: default
base         / ir.actions.server        / evaluation_type (selection)   : NEW selection_keys: ['equation', 'value'], hasdefault: default
base         / ir.actions.server        / fields_lines (one2many)       : DEL relation: ir.server.object.lines
# ... (truncated for brevity)
base         / res.users.settings       / _order                        : previously in module mail
base         / res.users.settings       / display_name (char)           : previously in module mail
base         / res.users.settings       / user_id (many2one)            : previously in module mail
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Model Changes in OpenUpgrade for Base Module
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the changes to models in the 'base' module, including obsolete and new models, as well as model movements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/base/17.0.1.3/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
---Models in module 'base'---
obsolete model ir.server.object.lines
new model ir.model.inherit
model res.users.settings (moved from mail)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Odoo Server-Wide Modules for OpenUpgrade in Shell
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to modify the Odoo configuration file to include the OpenUpgrade framework as a server-wide module. It sets the 'server_wide_modules' option to include 'web' and 'openupgrade_framework'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_framework/readme/CONFIGURE.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
[options]
server_wide_modules = web,openupgrade_framework
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changing Existing Code in OpenUpgrade Patch
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to change existing code in an OpenUpgrade patch using specific tags to mark the modification. This approach helps in tracking and managing changes to the original Odoo codebase.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_framework/readme/DEVELOP.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# <OpenUpgrade:CHANGE>
some code...
# </OpenUpgrade>
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/project/17.0.1.3/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# DONE: pre-migration: add the field and convert data from kanban_state, is_closed to state. Done in pre for avoiding the ORM computation.
```

TITLE: Defining Fields for Odoo Models in l10n_it_edi_ndd
DESCRIPTION: Specifies new fields added to Odoo models ('account.move', 'account.payment.method.line', 'l10n_it.document.type') by the 'l10n_it_edi_ndd' module. It details field names, types (many2one, selection, char), relationships, selection keys, and constraints like 'required' or 'hasdefault'. These fields enhance models for Italian localization requirements, particularly for electronic document handling and payment methods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_it_edi_ndd/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
---Fields in module 'l10n_it_edi_ndd'---
l10n_it_edi_ndd / account.move             / l10n_it_document_type (many2one): NEW relation: l10n_it.document.type, hasdefault: compute
l10n_it_edi_ndd / account.move             / l10n_it_payment_method (selection): NEW selection_keys: ['MP01', 'MP02', 'MP03', 'MP04', 'MP05', 'MP06', 'MP07', 'MP08', 'MP09', 'MP10', 'MP11', 'MP12', 'MP13', 'MP14', 'MP15', 'MP16', 'MP17', 'MP18', 'MP19', 'MP20', 'MP21', 'MP22', 'MP23'], hasdefault: compute
l10n_it_edi_ndd / account.payment.method.line / l10n_it_payment_method (selection): NEW selection_keys: ['MP01', 'MP02', 'MP03', 'MP04', 'MP05', 'MP06', 'MP07', 'MP08', 'MP09', 'MP10', 'MP11', 'MP12', 'MP13', 'MP14', 'MP15', 'MP16', 'MP17', 'MP18', 'MP19', 'MP20', 'MP21', 'MP22', 'MP23'], hasdefault: default
l10n_it_edi_ndd / l10n_it.document.type    / code (char)                   : NEW required
l10n_it_edi_ndd / l10n_it.document.type    / name (char)                   : NEW required
l10n_it_edi_ndd / l10n_it.document.type    / type (selection)              : NEW required, selection_keys: ['purchase', 'sale']
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Field Modifications in Product Module
DESCRIPTION: Details changes to fields in the product module, including new fields, modified relationships, and changed attributes. Migration actions are noted for each change.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/product/17.0.1.2/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
---Fields in module 'product'---
product      / product.attribute        / display_type (selection)      : selection_keys is now '['color', 'multi', 'pills', 'radio', 'select']' ('['color', 'pills', 'radio', 'select']')
# NOTHING TO DO: add new selection: multi

product      / product.attribute.value  / default_extra_price (float)   : NEW
# NOTHING TO DO: new feature for filling with this value the product variant attribute values created from this

product      / product.attribute.value  / image (binary)                : NEW attachment: True
# NOTHING TO DO: new feature for having an image linked to this value

product      / product.category         / product_properties_definition (properties_definition): NEW
product      / product.template         / product_properties (properties): NEW hasdefault: compute
# NOTHING TO DO: new feature for having properties on products

product      / product.document         / _inherits                     : NEW _inherits: {'ir.attachment': 'ir_attachment_id'}
product      / product.document         / active (boolean)              : NEW hasdefault: default
product      / product.document         / ir_attachment_id (many2one)   : NEW relation: ir.attachment, required
product      / product.product          / product_document_ids (one2many): NEW relation: product.document
product      / product.template         / product_document_ids (one2many): NEW relation: product.document
# DONE: post-migration: populated with attachments on product.template and product.product

product      / product.packaging        / product_id (many2one)         : now required
# DONE: pre-migration: delete records with no product_id, as they are not valid

product      / product.pricelist        / _order                        : _order is now 'sequence asc, id asc' ('sequence asc, id desc')
# DONE: post-migration: Write sequence for making sure the old pricelist order is preserved

product      / product.pricelist        / activity_ids (one2many)       : NEW relation: mail.activity
product      / product.pricelist        / message_follower_ids (one2many): NEW relation: mail.followers
product      / product.pricelist        / message_ids (one2many)        : NEW relation: mail.message
# NOTHING TO DO: Chatter + activity new feature

product      / product.pricelist.item   / active (boolean)              : DEL
# NOTHING TO DO: It was a related stored of the pricelist active, so not adding value

product      / product.product          / activity_user_id (many2one)   : not related anymore
product      / product.product          / activity_user_id (many2one)   : now a function
product      / product.product          / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
# NOTHING TO DO

product      / product.supplierinfo     / discount (float)              : NEW
# NOTHING TO DO

product      / product.tag              / color (integer)               : type is now 'char' ('integer')
# DONE: pre-migration: converted to the corresponding hexadecimal values

product      / product.template         / activity_user_id (many2one)   : not related anymore
product      / product.template         / activity_user_id (many2one)   : now a function
product      / product.template         / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
# NOTHING TO DO

product      / product.template.attribute.line / _order                        : _order is now 'sequence, attribute_id, id' ('attribute_id, id')
product      / product.template.attribute.line / sequence (integer)            : NEW hasdefault: default
# NOTHING TO DO: new feature
```

TITLE: OpenUpgrade Migration Analysis for stock_delivery Module
DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive list of models, fields, and XML records that have been moved from the 'delivery' module to the new 'stock_delivery' module, with migration instructions. Most items require no specific action as they are simply relocated.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/stock_delivery/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
---Models in module 'stock_delivery'---
model choose.delivery.package (moved from delivery) [transient]
# NOTHING TO DO

---Fields in module 'stock_delivery'---
stock_delivery / delivery.carrier         / invoice_policy (False)        : NEW selection_keys: ['estimated', 'real'], mode: modify
# NOTHING TO DO

stock_delivery / product.product          / country_of_origin (many2one)  : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / product.product          / hs_code (char)                : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / product.template         / country_of_origin (many2one)  : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / product.template         / hs_code (char)                : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.move               / weight (float)                : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.move.line          / carrier_id (many2one)         : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.move.line          / destination_country_code (char): previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.move.line          / sale_price (float)            : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.package.type       / package_carrier_type (selection): previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.package.type       / shipper_package_code (char)   : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / carrier_id (many2one)         : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / carrier_price (float)         : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / carrier_tracking_ref (char)   : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / carrier_tracking_url (char)   : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / delivery_type (selection)     : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / destination_country_code (char): previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / is_return_picking (boolean)   : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / package_ids (many2many)       : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / return_label_ids (one2many)   : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / shipping_weight (float)       : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / weight (float)                : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / weight_bulk (float)           : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.picking            / weight_uom_name (char)        : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.quant.package      / shipping_weight (float)       : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.quant.package      / weight (float)                : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.quant.package      / weight_is_kg (boolean)        : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.quant.package      / weight_uom_name (char)        : previously in module delivery
stock_delivery / stock.quant.package      / weight_uom_rounding (float)   : previously in module delivery
# NOTHING TO DO

stock_delivery / delivery.carrier         / route_ids (many2many)         : NEW relation: stock.route
stock_delivery / stock.route              / shipping_selectable (boolean) : NEW
# NOTHING TO DO: new feature that works only if shipping_selectable = True (by default is false)
```

TITLE: Defining New HR Contract Types in XML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the creation of new contract types for full-time, part-time, permanent, seasonal, and temporary employment. These are added as XML records with the 'noupdate' flag set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/hr/17.0.1.1/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
NEW hr.contract.type: hr.contract_type_full_time (noupdate)
NEW hr.contract.type: hr.contract_type_part_time (noupdate)
NEW hr.contract.type: hr.contract_type_permanent (noupdate)
NEW hr.contract.type: hr.contract_type_seasonal (noupdate)
NEW hr.contract.type: hr.contract_type_temporary (noupdate)
```

TITLE: Documenting Model, Field and XML Record Changes in sale_management Module
DESCRIPTION: This snippet documents the database changes required for migrating the sale_management module. It includes new fields on sale.order.template model, changes to XML records including digest tips with modified noupdate settings, and modifications to access rights definitions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/sale_management/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plain
CODE:
```
---Models in module 'sale_management'---
---Fields in module 'sale_management'---
sale_management / sale.order.template      / journal_id (many2one)         : NEW relation: account.journal
sale_management / sale.order.template      / prepayment_percent (float)    : NEW hasdefault: compute
---XML records in module 'sale_management'---
digest.tip: sale_management.digest_tip_sale1_management_0 (noupdate switched)
digest.tip: sale_management.digest_tip_sale_management_1 (noupdate switched)
NEW ir.model.access: sale_management.access_sale_order_option_invoice
NEW ir.model.access: sale_management.access_sale_order_option_readonly
DEL ir.model.access: sale_management.access_sale_order_option_all
DEL ir.ui.view: sale_management.res_config_settings_view_form_inherit_sale_management
```

TITLE: Plan and Line Modifications
DESCRIPTION: Changes to plan_id field and default applicability in analytic module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/analytic/17.0.1.2/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
analytic     / account.analytic.line    / plan_id (many2one)            : DEL relation: account.analytic.plan
analytic     / account.analytic.plan    / default_applicability (selection): not stored anymore
```

TITLE: Declaring New Account Report Records for Modelo 130
DESCRIPTION: This section lists the identifiers for newly created XML records within the 'l10n_es_modelo130' module during an openupgrade process. These records configure Odoo's accounting reports framework to generate the Spanish 'Modelo 130' tax declaration, defining the report structure (account.report), columns (account.report.column), individual calculation expressions (account.report.expression for casillas), and report lines (account.report.line).

TITLE: Adding Odoo Account Reports and Expressions - Plain Text
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a series of instructions to the Odoo database to add new records to the account.report, account.report.column, and account.report.expression models. Each 'NEW' instruction specifies the model and the external ID for the new report, column, or report expression, corresponding to Spanish tax forms and reporting requirements. These updates require appropriate Odoo modules and will result in new report structures being available in the system; the input is a list of records to create, and the output is their creation in the Odoo database.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_es/17.0.5.4/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_10

TITLE: Updating Date Fields in Odoo 'mrp.production' and 'mrp.workorder'
DESCRIPTION: Significant changes were made to date fields in `mrp.production` and `mrp.workorder`. `date_planned_finished` and `date_planned_start` were deleted. `date_finished` became a computed field (function). `date_start` became required in `mrp.production` and computed in `mrp.workorder`. A pre-migration step is needed to populate `date_start` and `date_finished` with planned dates where they are null, based on a specific Odoo commit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/mrp/17.0.2.0/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Odoo Schema Change
CODE:
```
mrp          / mrp.production           / date_finished (datetime)      : now a function
mrp          / mrp.production           / date_planned_finished (datetime): DEL
mrp          / mrp.production           / date_planned_start (datetime) : DEL required
mrp          / mrp.production           / date_start (datetime)         : now required
mrp          / mrp.workorder            / date_finished (datetime)      : now a function
mrp          / mrp.workorder            / date_planned_finished (datetime): DEL
mrp          / mrp.workorder            / date_planned_start (datetime) : DEL
mrp          / mrp.workorder            / date_start (datetime)         : now a function
# DONE: pre-migration: Fill date_start and date_finished with the planned ones when no value. More details at https://github.com/odoo/odoo/commit/d4ed9f8a50fbe5e31bc36bb44dbda24349b66e08
```

DESCRIPTION: This snippet details the introduction of new fields to several core Odoo models (e.g., account.move, account.tax, product.template, res.company), including binary fields for attachments, integer indices, JSON message tracking, datetime fields, multiple selection fields with specified choices, and character fields for transaction codes and credentials. Some fields specify default or compute behavior. These additions facilitate Hungarian EDI compliance and enable capturing, transmitting, and processing the information required by local legislation. Inputs are database records with the new fields; outputs are enhanced data and user interface capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_hu_edi/17.0.1.0.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

TITLE: Deleting Odoo Account Tax Configurations and Reports - Text
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses the 'DEL' command format to specify deletion of records in Odoo models, targeting tax report lines, tax groups, and tax templates related to Portuguese VAT ('l10n_pt'). It does not require dependencies but is context-specific to Odoo's migration tools (like OpenUpgrade), and expects a compatible system capable of parsing and executing these directives. Inputs are record identifiers; no output is shown, and running this deletes the data, so should be used in controlled maintenance windows or tested environments.

TITLE: Removing Code in OpenUpgrade Patch
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to remove code in an OpenUpgrade patch by commenting it out and using specific tags. This method preserves the original code while effectively removing it from execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_framework/readme/DEVELOP.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
# <OpenUpgrade:REMOVE>
# Comment the code, instead of removing it.
# </OpenUpgrade>
```

TITLE: Configuring OpenUpgrade Path in Odoo Configuration File - INI (options block)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to add the upgrade_path key to the Odoo configuration file in the [options] section. You must substitute /PATH_TO_openupgrade_scripts_MODULE/scripts/ with the absolute path to your OpenUpgrade scripts folder. The configuration file should be accessible and correctly referenced when starting Odoo. Only one path per key is supported; multiple paths require repeated configuration or scripting.

```

TITLE: Transferring Employee Private Address Data in SQL
DESCRIPTION: SQL commands to transfer private address data from res_partner to hr_employee and anonymize the original partner record.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/hr/17.0.1.1/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
UPDATE hr_employee e
SET private_street = p.street,
    private_street2 = p.street2,
    private_city = p.city,
    private_state_id = p.state_id,
    private_zip = p.zip,
    private_country_id = p.country_id,
    private_email = p.email,
    private_phone = p.phone,
    lang = p.lang
FROM res_partner p
WHERE e.address_home_id = p.id;

UPDATE res_partner
SET name = 'Private Address',
    street = NULL,
    street2 = NULL,
    city = NULL,
    state_id = NULL,
    zip = NULL,
    country_id = NULL,
    email = NULL,
    phone = NULL
WHERE id IN (SELECT address_home_id FROM hr_employee WHERE address_home_id IS NOT NULL);
```

TITLE: Creating HR Leave Accrual Plan Model in Python
DESCRIPTION: New model hr.leave.accrual.plan with various fields for managing leave accrual plans.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/hr_holidays/17.0.1.6/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class HrLeaveAccrualPlan(models.Model):
    _name = 'hr.leave.accrual.plan'
    
    accrued_gain_time = fields.Selection([
        ('end', 'End'),
        ('start', 'Start')
    ], required=True, default='end')
    active = fields.Boolean(default=True)
    added_value_type = fields.Selection([
        ('day', 'Day'),
        ('hour', 'Hour')
    ], compute='_compute_added_value_type', store=True)
    carryover_date = fields.Selection([
        ('allocation', 'Allocation'),
        ('other', 'Other'),
        ('year_start', 'Year Start')
    ], required=True, default='year_start')
    carryover_day = fields.Integer(default=1)
    carryover_month = fields.Selection([
        ('jan', 'January'), ('feb', 'February'), ('mar', 'March'),
        ('apr', 'April'), ('may', 'May'), ('jun', 'June'),
        ('jul', 'July'), ('aug', 'August'), ('sep', 'September'),
        ('oct', 'October'), ('nov', 'November'), ('dec', 'December')
    ], default='jan')
    company_id = fields.Many2one('res.company', compute='_compute_company_id')
    is_based_on_worked_time = fields.Boolean(compute='_compute_is_based_on_worked_time')
```

The format "DEL model: identifier" denotes removal of a record of type 'model' with the given unique identifier, following Odoo migration/data cleanup conventions. No external dependencies are required as this is processed by Odoo's migration tooling. Key parameters are the record model and identifier, with the limitation that this script only applies to Odoo instances and cannot be executed standalone.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_nl/17.0.3.4/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```

TITLE: Defining New Transient Models - Odoo ORM - Python
DESCRIPTION: Defines two new transient (wizard) models, 'l10n_in.withhold.wizard' and 'l10n_in.withhold.wizard.line', in the module 'l10n_in_withholding'. These wizard models facilitate UI-driven temporary operations for withholding tax processing within Odoo. Dependencies: Odoo ORM and module registration. Expected input is form data from the user; output is typically a transient record processed further by Odoo workflows. Intended for non-persistent auxiliary record handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_in_withholding/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
new model l10n_in.withhold.wizard [transient]
new model l10n_in.withhold.wizard.line [transient]
```

TITLE: Updating Event Ticket Order and Adding Price Include Field in Python
DESCRIPTION: Changes the ordering of event tickets and adds a new computed field for price including tax. The _order is modified to include sequence and the new price_incl field is added with a default compute method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/event_sale/17.0.1.3/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
event_sale   / event.event.ticket       / _order                        : _order is now 'event_id, sequence, price, name, id' ('event_id, price')
event_sale   / event.event.ticket       / price_incl (float)            : NEW hasdefault: compute
```

TITLE: Adding New Canadian Localization Tax Reporting Records (OpenUpgrade Configuration)
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the creation of new Odoo accounting records for Canadian tax reporting (l10n_ca). This includes definitions for new tax reports (GST/HST, PST BC, PST MB, PST SK, QST), report columns, report expressions (calculations and tag references), and report lines corresponding to specific fields on Canadian tax forms. These additions are part of an upgrade or setup process to implement current Canadian tax reporting structures.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_ca/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

TITLE: Updating Event Model Fields in Python
DESCRIPTION: Changes to the event.event model include modifying the _order attribute, updating the activity_user_id field, removing auto_confirm, and adding new fields like badge_format, badge_image, and lang.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/event/17.0.1.8/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class EventEvent(models.Model):
    _inherit = 'event.event'
    _order = 'date_begin, id'
    
    activity_user_id = fields.Many2one(compute='_compute_activity_user_id')
    badge_format = fields.Selection([
        ('A4_french_fold', 'A4 French Fold'),
        ('A6', 'A6'),
        ('four_per_sheet', 'Four per sheet')
    ], required=True, default='A6')
    badge_image = fields.Binary(attachment=True)
    lang = fields.Selection(selection=lambda self: self.env['res.lang'].get_installed())
    rating_ids = fields.One2many('rating.rating', 'res_id', string='Ratings')
    registration_properties_definition = fields.PropertiesDefinition()
```

TITLE: Deleting Account and Report Records in Odoo Migration File - Migration Operation
DESCRIPTION: This snippet contains a series of Odoo migration operation commands prefixed by 'DEL' or 'NEW', which instruct the OpenUpgrade system to delete, rename, or create accounting templates, reports, and columns for the l10n_ma localization. Each 'DEL' line specifies a model and a record identifier to delete, while 'NEW' and renaming commands handle creation and refactoring of reports and columns. The operations expect to be run in the OpenUpgrade migration context, and record names must match existing Odoo IDs. No parameters are used, and the input/output consists of Odoo database state changes. These commands typically reside in a migration script executed during module upgrades.

TITLE: Deleting and Adding Odoo l10n_dk Accounting Data (Configuration)
DESCRIPTION: This script performs data migration tasks for the Odoo Danish localization module (l10n_dk). It uses `DEL` commands to remove numerous records from models like `account.account.template`, `account.chart.template`, `account.fiscal.position.account.template`, `account.fiscal.position.tax.template`, `account.fiscal.position.template`, and `account.tax.template`. It also uses `NEW` commands to add records to `account.report.expression` and `account.report.line`. These operations are identified by Odoo external IDs (e.g., `l10n_dk.a4454`, `l10n_dk.dk_chart_template`) and are typically executed during an OpenUpgrade process to adjust the accounting setup.

TITLE: Documenting Field Changes in 'sales_team' Module for OpenUpgrade
DESCRIPTION: Lists changes to field definitions in the 'sales_team' module, showing deleted 'message_main_attachment_id' fields, newly added 'rating_ids' fields for both 'crm.team' and 'crm.team.member' models, and a removed menu item 'menu_sale_config'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/sales_team/17.0.1.1/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
---Models in module 'sales_team'---
---Fields in module 'sales_team'---
sales_team   / crm.team                 / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
sales_team   / crm.team                 / rating_ids (one2many)         : NEW relation: rating.rating
sales_team   / crm.team.member          / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
sales_team   / crm.team.member          / rating_ids (one2many)         : NEW relation: rating.rating
---XML records in module 'sales_team'---
DEL ir.ui.menu: sales_team.menu_sale_config
```

payment_stripe / payment.transaction      / stripe_payment_intent (char)  : DEL
---XML records in module 'payment_stripe'---

NEW ir.ui.view: payment_stripe.payment_form

DEL ir.ui.view: payment_stripe.manage
```

TITLE: Adding New Italian EDI Fields to Odoo Sale Order Model - Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines several new fields for the 'sale.order' model within the 'l10n_it_edi_sale' Odoo module, intended for tracking Italian-specific attributes required for EDI (electronic invoicing). Dependencies include the base Odoo framework and the localization module. Fields added: 'l10n_it_cig' (CIG code, Char), 'l10n_it_cup' (CUP code, Char), 'l10n_it_origin_document_date' (Document date, Date), 'l10n_it_origin_document_name' (Document identifier, Char), and 'l10n_it_origin_document_type' (Document type, Selection - values: 'agreement', 'contract', 'purchase_order'). The expected input for the selection field is restricted to the defined keys. These fields facilitate compliance with Italian EDI requirements and may appear in forms or reports.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_it_edi_sale/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
l10n_it_edi_sale / sale.order               / l10n_it_cig (char)            : NEW
l10n_it_edi_sale / sale.order               / l10n_it_cup (char)            : NEW
l10n_it_edi_sale / sale.order               / l10n_it_origin_document_date (date): NEW
l10n_it_edi_sale / sale.order               / l10n_it_origin_document_name (char): NEW
l10n_it_edi_sale / sale.order               / l10n_it_origin_document_type (selection): NEW selection_keys: ['agreement', 'contract', 'purchase_order']
```

TITLE: Adding New Fields to res.partner Model in Python
DESCRIPTION: Adds new char fields 'sst_registration_number' and 'ttx_registration_number' to the res.partner model, and modifies the 'ubl_cii_format' field with new selection keys.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_my_ubl_pint/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class ResPartner(models.Model):
    _inherit = 'res.partner'

    sst_registration_number = fields.Char(string='SST Registration Number')
    ttx_registration_number = fields.Char(string='TTX Registration Number')
    ubl_cii_format = fields.Selection(
        selection_add=[
            ('facturx', 'Factur-X'),
            ('nlcius', 'NLCIUS'),
            ('pint_jp', 'PINT JP'),
            ('pint_my', 'PINT MY'),
            ('ubl_a_nz', 'UBL A-NZ'),
            ('ubl_bis3', 'UBL BIS 3.0'),
            ('ubl_sg', 'UBL SG'),
            ('xrechnung', 'XRechnung'),
        ],
        ondelete={'facturx': 'set null', 'nlcius': 'set null', 'pint_jp': 'set null', 'pint_my': 'set null',
                  'ubl_a_nz': 'set null', 'ubl_bis3': 'set null', 'ubl_sg': 'set null', 'xrechnung': 'set null'}
    )
```

TITLE: Updating Event Ticket Sequence in SQL for OpenUpgrade
DESCRIPTION: This SQL snippet preserves the previous order on existing event tickets by assigning the sequence based on price. It's part of the pre-migration process for the event_sale module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/event_sale/17.0.1.3/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
UPDATE event_event_ticket
SET sequence = subquery.new_sequence
FROM (
    SELECT id, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY event_id ORDER BY price, name, id) AS new_sequence
    FROM event_event_ticket
) AS subquery
WHERE event_event_ticket.id = subquery.id;
```

TITLE: Updating HR Leave Model Fields in Python
DESCRIPTION: Changes to the hr.leave model fields, including new fields, modified relations, and function changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/hr_holidays/17.0.1.6/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class HrLeave(models.Model):
    _name = 'hr.leave'
    
    activity_user_id = fields.Many2one(compute='_compute_activity_user_id')
    category_id = fields.Many2one('hr.employee.category')
    company_id = fields.Many2one('res.company', compute='_compute_company_id', store=True)
    date_from = fields.Datetime(compute='_compute_date_from')
    date_to = fields.Datetime(compute='_compute_date_to')
    employee_ids = fields.Many2many('hr.employee', compute='_compute_employee_ids')
    mode_company_id = fields.Many2one('res.company')
    number_of_days = fields.Float(compute='_compute_number_of_days')
    number_of_hours = fields.Float(compute='_compute_number_of_hours', store=True)
    rating_ids = fields.One2many('rating.rating', 'res_id', 'Ratings')
    resource_calendar_id = fields.Many2one('resource.calendar', compute='_compute_resource_calendar_id')
    website_message_ids = fields.One2many('mail.message', 'res_id', 'Website Messages')
```

TITLE: Defining New Abstract Model in Spreadsheet Module
DESCRIPTION: Introduces a new abstract model named 'spreadsheet.mixin' in the spreadsheet module. Abstract models in Odoo are used as base classes for other models to inherit from, providing reusable functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/spreadsheet/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
new model spreadsheet.mixin [abstract]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding 'bom_id' Field to Odoo 'stock.scrap'
DESCRIPTION: A new Many2one field `bom_id` relating to `mrp.bom` has been added to the `stock.scrap` model. This supports a new feature allowing the scrapping of kit components based on a BoM. Existing scrap records are not expected to have this field populated.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/mrp/17.0.2.0/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: Odoo Schema Change
CODE:
```
mrp          / stock.scrap              / bom_id (many2one)             : NEW relation: mrp.bom
# NOTHING TO DO: New feature to scrap a kit, so existing scraps shouldn't have this filled.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Modifying Default Sort Order for Odoo 'mrp.production'
DESCRIPTION: The default sort order (`_order` attribute) for the `mrp.production` model has been updated from 'priority desc, date_planned_start asc,id' to 'priority desc, date_start asc,id'. This changes how manufacturing orders are sorted by default.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/mrp/17.0.2.0/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Odoo Schema Change
CODE:
```
mrp          / mrp.production           / _order                        : _order is now 'priority desc, date_start asc,id' ('priority desc, date_planned_start asc,id')
```

fleet        / fleet.vehicle            / activity_user_id (many2one)   : not related anymore

fleet        / fleet.vehicle            / image_1024 (binary)           : NEW attachment: True, isrelated: related, stored
fleet        / fleet.vehicle            / image_128 (binary)            : is now stored
fleet        / fleet.vehicle            / image_1920 (binary)           : NEW attachment: True
fleet        / fleet.vehicle            / image_256 (binary)            : NEW attachment: True, isrelated: related, stored
fleet        / fleet.vehicle            / image_512 (binary)            : NEW attachment: True, isrelated: related, stored
fleet        / fleet.vehicle            / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
fleet        / fleet.vehicle            / order_date (date)             : NEW
fleet        / fleet.vehicle            / vehicle_properties (properties): NEW hasdefault: compute

fleet        / fleet.vehicle.log.contract / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
fleet        / fleet.vehicle.log.services / activity_user_id (many2one)   : not related anymore
fleet        / fleet.vehicle.log.services / activity_user_id (many2one)   : now a function
fleet        / fleet.vehicle.log.services / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
# NOTHING TO DO
fleet        / fleet.vehicle.model      / image_1024 (binary)           : NEW attachment: True, isrelated: related, stored

fleet        / fleet.vehicle.model      / image_1920 (binary)           : NEW attachment: True
fleet        / fleet.vehicle.model      / image_256 (binary)            : NEW attachment: True, isrelated: related, stored
fleet        / fleet.vehicle.model      / image_512 (binary)            : NEW attachment: True, isrelated: related, stored

TITLE: Updating Mixin-Related Fields in Odoo 'mrp' Models
DESCRIPTION: Several fields related to Odoo mixins (like mail, rating, activity) have changed across `mrp.bom`, `mrp.production`, and `mrp.unbuild` models. This includes deletion of `message_main_attachment_id`, addition of `rating_ids`, and changes to `activity_user_id` (becoming non-related or computed). No specific migration actions are needed for these mixin updates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/mrp/17.0.2.0/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Odoo Schema Change
CODE:
```
mrp          / mrp.bom                  / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
mrp          / mrp.bom                  / rating_ids (one2many)         : NEW relation: rating.rating
mrp          / mrp.production           / activity_user_id (many2one)   : not related anymore
mrp          / mrp.production           / activity_user_id (many2one)   : now a function
mrp          / mrp.production           / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
mrp          / mrp.production           / rating_ids (one2many)         : NEW relation: rating.rating
mrp          / mrp.unbuild              / activity_user_id (many2one)   : not related anymore
mrp          / mrp.unbuild              / activity_user_id (many2one)   : now a function
mrp          / mrp.unbuild              / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
mrp          / mrp.unbuild              / rating_ids (one2many)         : NEW relation: rating.rating
# NOTHING TO DO: Mixin changes that don't require anything here.
```

TITLE: Deleting Account Templates with OpenUpgrade DSL - Custom DSL
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the use of a domain-specific language (DSL) to issue batch deletions of account templates within an Odoo (OpenUpgrade) migration script. Each line with the 'DEL' operation followed by a model name and external ID triggers the deletion of the specified account template. No external dependencies are required beyond the OpenUpgrade migration environment. The expected input is a list of formatted deletion commands targeting 'account.account.template' models, and the output is the removal of the referenced records from the system. Limitations include reliance on the accuracy of external IDs and the correct mapping of model names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_de/17.0.2.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

TITLE: Adding Custom Fields to Account Move for NILVERA E-Invoice - Odoo Model Extension - Python
DESCRIPTION: Extends the account.move model in Odoo by adding two new fields: l10n_tr_nilvera_send_status (a selection field with statuses such as 'error', 'not_sent', 'sent', 'succeed', 'unknown', and 'waiting') and l10n_tr_nilvera_uuid (a character field for storing the NILVERA UUID). These fields support tracking and integration of document processing with NILVERA for Turkish e-invoice flows. Requires Odoo model extension mechanisms, and is intended for use within the l10n_tr_nilvera_einvoice module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_tr_nilvera_einvoice/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
l10n_tr_nilvera_einvoice / account.move             / l10n_tr_nilvera_send_status (selection): NEW selection_keys: ['error', 'not_sent', 'sent', 'succeed', 'unknown', 'waiting']
l10n_tr_nilvera_einvoice / account.move             / l10n_tr_nilvera_uuid (char)   : NEW
```

TITLE: New Model Definition for Romanian EDI Document
DESCRIPTION: Defines a new model 'l10n_ro_edi.document' for handling Romanian electronic invoicing documents. This model includes fields for managing attachments, invoice references, and document states.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_ro_efactura/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<record model="ir.model" id="model_l10n_ro_edi_document">
    <field name="name">l10n_ro_edi.document</field>
    <field name="model">l10n_ro_edi.document</field>
    <field name="arch" type="xml">
        <form>
            <field name="attachment_id"/>
            <field name="datetime"/>
            <field name="invoice_id"/>
            <field name="key_certificate"/>
            <field name="key_loading"/>
            <field name="key_signature"/>
            <field name="message"/>
            <field name="state"/>
        </form>
    </field>
</record>
```

TITLE: Deleting Model Records - Odoo OpenUpgrade Declarative/SQL
DESCRIPTION: These statements delete specific records by external ID from Odoo model tables (such as fiscal position, account, tax, and reconciliation templates) as part of a migration or cleanup step in OpenUpgrade. No explicit dependencies are required, but this must be executed within an Odoo/OpenUpgrade migration context where these model records exist. Each DEL references a model and the record's external identifier; no inputs are required, and the effect is irreversible deletion of the referenced database entries. Limitations include requiring administrative access and careful identification of referenced external IDs, as accidental deletions may break accounting data integrity.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_de/17.0.2.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_14

TITLE: Defining Payment Xendit Module Changes
DESCRIPTION: Lists the changes in the payment_xendit module including new fields for the payment.provider model and new XML records. Includes Xendit-specific fields for API integration such as secret key and webhook token.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/payment_xendit/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
---Models in module 'payment_xendit'---
---Fields in module 'payment_xendit'---
payment_xendit / payment.provider         / code (False)                  : NEW selection_keys: ['adyen', 'aps', 'asiapay', 'authorize', 'buckaroo', 'custom', 'demo', 'flutterwave', 'mercado_pago', 'mollie', 'none', 'paypal', 'razorpay', 'sips', 'stripe', 'xendit'], mode: modify
payment_xendit / payment.provider         / xendit_secret_key (char)      : NEW
payment_xendit / payment.provider         / xendit_webhook_token (char)   : NEW
---XML records in module 'payment_xendit'---
NEW ir.ui.view: payment_xendit.payment_provider_form_xendit
NEW ir.ui.view: payment_xendit.redirect_form
```

TITLE: Deleting l10n_ro Account Reconciliation and Tax Records using DEL Command
DESCRIPTION: This script snippet lists multiple `DEL` commands, likely for the OpenUpgrade framework or a similar Odoo data management tool, to remove obsolete Romanian localization data records. It targets specific records in `account.reconcile.model.line.template`, `account.reconcile.model.template`, `account.tax.group`, and `account.tax.template` models using their `l10n_ro.*` XML IDs. The `(noupdate)` flag associated with `account.tax.group` records indicates they should be deleted but potentially skipped during updates if they already exist (though in a `DEL` context, it usually ensures deletion regardless of `noupdate` status in the original definition). This script is intended for database cleanup during migration.

TITLE: Adding Custom Sale Order Form View for Italian EDI Fields - Odoo XML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet references a new XML UI record (l10n_it_edi_sale.view_order_form_inherit_l10n_it_edi_sale) added to the 'l10n_it_edi_sale' module in Odoo. The purpose is to extend or modify the sale order form to display or process the new Italian EDI-related fields. TITLE: Deleting Selection Keys from l10n_it_withholding_reason Field in Odoo
DESCRIPTION: Removes a specific set of selection keys ('A' through 'ZO') from the 'l10n_it_withholding_reason' selection field on the 'account.tax.template' model within the 'l10n_it_edi_withholding' Odoo module. This operation alters the allowed values for the withholding reason, typically performed as part of an upgrade script.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_it_edi_withholding/17.0.0.1/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
l10n_it_edi_withholding / account.tax.template     / l10n_it_withholding_reason (selection): DEL selection_keys: ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E', 'G', 'H', 'I', 'K', 'L', 'L1', 'M', 'M1', 'M2', 'N', 'O', 'O1', 'P', 'Q', 'R', 'S', 'T', 'U', 'V', 'V1', 'V2', 'W', 'X', 'Y', 'Z', 'ZO']
```

TITLE: Deleting Account Templates with OpenUpgrade Script - Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: This snippet removes a large list of account.account.template records by referencing their unique XML IDs (external identifiers) using the 'DEL' operation. It is intended for use in an OpenUpgrade or Odoo migration context, where automated cleanup or data migration scripts process such commands. The file assumes access to the OpenUpgrade framework or migration tool that recognizes the 'DEL' operation; no standard software dependencies are required but the script is not standalone and must be used within the OpenUpgrade environment. Each line is structured as 'DEL <model>: <xml_id>', ensuring specific account templates are targeted for deletion with no parameters required and no outputs except the removal of the records. There are no error handling provisions or transactional guarantees in this raw format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_syscohada/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

TITLE: Populating Sale Status for Event Registrations in SQL for OpenUpgrade
DESCRIPTION: This SQL snippet fills the new sale_status field for event registrations using existing is_paid and sale order line price data. It's part of the pre-migration process for the event_sale module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/event_sale/17.0.1.3/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sql
CODE:
```
UPDATE event_registration er
SET sale_status = CASE
    WHEN er.is_paid THEN 'sold'
    WHEN sol.price_total > 0 THEN 'to_pay'
    ELSE 'free'
END
FROM sale_order_line sol
WHERE er.sale_order_line_id = sol.id;
```

TITLE: Registering Actions, Views, Access, and Rules for Facturae Certificate in Odoo - XML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists new XML registry records that create window actions, access controls, security rules, menus, and UI views for interacting with the Facturae certificate features in Odoo. Dependencies include Odoo's XML model data loading mechanisms and module structure. Primary entities affected are the certificate definition, digital signing interface, and related Odoo models such as company, account move, tax, and unit of measure. Each XML record typically specifies a unique ID and references associated models and views, with constraints established by Odoo's security and view inheritance system.

SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_ae/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_export_tax
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_import_tax
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_purchase_tax_0
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_purchase_tax_5
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_purchase_tax_exempted
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_purchase_tax_reverse_charge
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_0
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_5_abu_dhabi
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_5_ajman
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_5_dubai
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_5_fujairah
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_5_ras_al_khaima
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_5_sharjah
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_5_umm_al_quwain
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_exempted
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_reverse_charge_abu_dhabi
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_reverse_charge_ajman
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_reverse_charge_dubai
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_reverse_charge_fujairah
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_reverse_charge_ras_al_khaima
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_reverse_charge_sharjah
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_reverse_charge_umm_al_quwain
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_ae.uae_sale_tax_tourist_refund

# NOTHING TO DO: Glitch in the selection options recognition.
```

TITLE: Deleting XML View Record in Odoo via Manifest Syntax - plaintext
DESCRIPTION: This snippet specifies the deletion of an XML record ('website_mass_mailing.iframe_css_assets_edit') from the ir.ui.view model in the Odoo 'website_mass_mailing' module. LANGUAGE: plaintext

```
DEL ir.ui.view: website_mass_mailing.iframe_css_assets_edit
```

TITLE: Modifying 'progress_step_ids' Relationship in 'onboarding.progress' (Plaintext)
DESCRIPTION: Details the change of the 'progress_step_ids' field in the 'onboarding.progress' model from a One2many to a Many2many relationship. The underlying database table name for the relation is updated. This change is managed automatically by the Odoo ORM.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/onboarding/17.0.1.2/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
onboarding   / onboarding.progress      / progress_step_ids (one2many)  : table is now 'onboarding_progress_onboarding_progress_step_rel' ('False')
onboarding   / onboarding.progress      / progress_step_ids (one2many)  : type is now 'many2many' ('one2many')
# NOTHING TO DO: handle by ORM
```

TITLE: Registering Withholding Tax Views and Actions - Odoo XML Records - XML
DESCRIPTION: Defines new access controls, actions, and form/view templates as XML records for integrating withholding-related features into the Odoo UI. This includes window actions, model access for the transient wizard models, multiple inherited views for forms (such as moves, payments, configuration, and taxes). Dependencies: the Odoo 'l10n_in_withholding' module, referenced models and UI structures. Expected input is XML files loaded with module updates; output affects application menu, available views, and user access rights. Ensure the corresponding Python fields and models exist before applying these records.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_in_withholding/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: xml
CODE:
```
NEW ir.actions.act_window: l10n_in_withholding.l10n_in_withholding_entry_form_action
NEW ir.model.access: l10n_in_withholding.access_l10n_in_withhold_wizard
NEW ir.model.access: l10n_in_withholding.access_l10n_in_withhold_wizard_line
NEW ir.ui.view: l10n_in_withholding.account_move_view_form_inherit_l10n_in_withholding
NEW ir.ui.view: l10n_in_withholding.res_config_settings_view_form_inherit_l10n_in_withholding
NEW ir.ui.view: l10n_in_withholding.tds_entry_view_form
NEW ir.ui.view: l10n_in_withholding.view_account_payment_form_inherit_l10n_in_withholding
NEW ir.ui.view: l10n_in_withholding.view_tax_form_inherited_l10n_in_withholding
```

DEL account.account.template: l10n_dk.a4660
DEL account.account.template: l10n_dk.a4664

TITLE: Deleting Account Account Template Records - Odoo Data Migration - Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: This snippet issues delete (DEL) commands for various account.account.template records related to the Greek localization chart of accounts in an Odoo/OpenUpgrade environment. Dependencies include access to the relevant Odoo or OpenUpgrade database and proper configuration for the data loading process. TITLE: Deleting l10n_es Fiscal Position Tax Templates

Each line specifies a record to be deleted, identified by its XML ID, which belongs to the Spanish localization module (`l10n_es`). These deletions target various IRPF (Spanish income tax) and VAT combinations, including duplicates or variations indicated by `_2` suffixes.

TITLE: Registering Industry Classifications via Text Syntax - Odoo Data Migration - Text
DESCRIPTION: This snippet consists of registry-like text lines used to declare new industry classification records for Odoo\'s l10n_my_edi module, typically for migration or upgrades within the OpenUpgrade tool. Each line uses the syntax \"NEW l10n_my_edi.industry_classification: l10n_my_edi.class_xxxxx\" to specify the addition of a classification identified by its code. No programming language is involved; processing depends on external migration or deployment scripts that parse this format and create database records accordingly. All entries must follow the mentioned structure, and the system must ensure referenced classes like l10n_my_edi.class_26701 exist and are valid.

TITLE: Deleting Odoo Tax Groups (l10n_mx)
DESCRIPTION: Deletes several `account.tax.group` records specific to the Mexican localization. These groups categorize taxes (e.g., IEPS, ISR Withholding, IVA, IVA Withholding) and are often used for reporting and aggregation purposes. The `(noupdate)` flag suggests these might be handled specially during updates, potentially preventing their recreation if they exist.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_mx/17.0.2.2/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_8

DEL account.tax.group: l10n_mx.tax_group_isr_ret_10 (noupdate)
DEL account.tax.group: l10n_mx.tax_group_iva_0 (noupdate)
DEL account.tax.group: l10n_mx.tax_group_iva_16 (noupdate)

TITLE: Setting OpenUpgrade Path via Odoo Command-Line Option - Shell Script
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to launch an Odoo instance with the OpenUpgrade migration path specified directly on the command line using the --upgrade-path option. It requires that you replace /PATH_TO_openupgrade_scripts_MODULE/scripts/ with the actual absolute directory path containing your OpenUpgrade scripts. The Odoo binary and required Python environment must already be available. This method is suitable for runtime overrides and temporary customizations. No additional parameters are mandated, but other Odoo CLI arguments may supplement this call as needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/readme/CONFIGURE.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
--upgrade-path=/PATH_TO_openupgrade_scripts_MODULE/scripts/
```

TITLE: Deleting and Creating Records with Odoo XML-ID DSL - Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the use of a custom plaintext DSL for Odoo upgrades or migration scripts, where each line specifies either the deletion ('DEL') of an Odoo record (typically by model and XML-ID) or the creation ('NEW') of a new ir.ui.view record. The script targets models such as account.group.template, account.tax.group, account.tax.template, and ir.ui.view, and is designed to be processed by an automated migration framework or patching tool within the Odoo ecosystem. Input consists of one directive per line, and the operations are not reversible or conditional; correct object references (XML-IDs) and model names must be used for successful execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_sk/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext

TITLE: Deleting Obsolete Canadian Localization Records (OpenUpgrade Configuration)
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the deletion of various Odoo accounting records related to Canadian localization (l10n_ca). This includes fiscal position templates for different provinces, specific tax groups (like GST 5%, HST 13%, PST 8%, QST 9.975%), and tax templates for GST and provincial taxes (BC, MB). These deletions are likely part of an upgrade script removing outdated configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_ca/17.0.1.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

TITLE: Field Modifications in Survey Module
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows various field modifications in the 'survey' module, including deletions, additions, and changes in field properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/survey/17.0.3.6/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
survey       / survey.question          / is_conditional (boolean)      : DEL
survey       / survey.question          / triggering_answer_id (many2one): DEL relation: survey.question.answer
survey       / survey.question          / triggering_answer_ids (many2many): NEW relation: survey.question.answer
# DONE: post-migration: empty triggering_answer_id when is_condition is not checked + transform many2one to many2many

survey       / survey.question          / triggering_question_id (many2one): DEL relation: survey.question
# NOTHING TO DO: there is a m2m non-stored computed instead

survey       / survey.question.answer   / _order                        : _order is now 'question_id, sequence, id' ('sequence, id')
survey       / survey.survey            / activity_user_id (many2one)   : not related anymore
survey       / survey.survey            / activity_user_id (many2one)   : now a function
survey       / survey.survey            / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
survey       / survey.survey            / rating_ids (one2many)         : NEW relation: rating.rating
survey       / survey.survey            / scoring_type (selection)      : selection_keys is now '['no_scoring', 'scoring_with_answers', 'scoring_with_answers_after_page', 'scoring_without_answers']' ('['no_scoring', 'scoring_with_answers', 'scoring_without_answers']')
survey       / survey.survey            / survey_type (selection)       : NEW required, selection_keys: ['assessment', 'custom', 'live_session', 'survey'], hasdefault: default
survey       / survey.user_input        / activity_user_id (many2one)   : not related anymore
survey       / survey.user_input        / activity_user_id (many2one)   : now a function
survey       / survey.user_input        / message_main_attachment_id (many2one): DEL relation: ir.attachment
survey       / survey.user_input        / rating_ids (one2many)         : NEW relation: rating.rating
survey       / survey.user_input        / survey_first_submitted (boolean): NEW
# NOTHING TO DO
```

```

The input consists of a list of deletion operations and outputs depend on the processing tool used.

TITLE: Deleting Mexican Account Group Templates - YAML Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Collection of deletion commands for removing account group templates from the Mexican localization. These templates cover various accounting categories including professional fees, customs fees, taxes (IEPS, IVA, ISR), income sources, and financial instruments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_mx/17.0.2.2/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
DEL account.group.template: l10n_mx.account_subgroup_honorarios_a_personas_morales_residentes_del_extranjero_partes_relacionadas_2
DEL account.group.template: l10n_mx.account_subgroup_honorarios_a_personas_morales_residentes_del_extranjero_partes_relacionadas_3
DEL account.group.template: l10n_mx.account_subgroup_honorarios_a_personas_morales_residentes_nacionales
[...additional deletion commands...]
```

TITLE: Deleting Tax Templates and UI Views - OpenUpgrade Spec - OpenUpgrade spec
DESCRIPTION: These snippet lines specify delete operations for account tax templates and a UI view in the Odoo localization for Saudi Arabia within an OpenUpgrade migration script. No external dependencies are required; these commands are interpreted by the OpenUpgrade migration system. Inputs are in the form 'DEL model: record_id', removing the designated records during migration, and they produce no direct output other than the removal effect in the database schema. These entries must be placed in OpenUpgrade specification (spec) files and assume that the OpenUpgrade tool will process them correctly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_sa/17.0.2.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: OpenUpgrade spec
CODE:
```

DEL account.tax.template: l10n_sa.sa_withholding_tax_15_paid_services_from_main_branch
DEL account.tax.template: l10n_sa.sa_withholding_tax_15_royalties

TITLE: Deleting Account Templates in Odoo Migration File - Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the syntax for deleting multiple account.account.template records by their XML IDs in an Odoo OpenUpgrade migration context. The 'DEL' keyword is followed by the model and the record's external identifier from the Swedish localization (l10n_se) module. No dependencies are required to interpret this, but the script relies on Odoo's migration processing framework; it is not directly executable as code. Input consists of a list of 'DEL account.account.template: <xml_id>' entries. Output is the removal of those records from the Odoo database when this migration is executed. This format is constrained to Odoo/OpenUpgrade migration usage and cannot be used as standalone application logic.

TITLE: Deleting and Creating Odoo Accounting Templates and Reports with Custom DSL - custom-dsl
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet uses a custom domain-specific language (DSL) to issue bulk deletion (DEL) and creation (NEW) commands for various Odoo accounting template records, group templates, fiscal positions, charts, and report entities. The DEL statements remove specific entities (such as accounts, fiscal positions, chart templates, group templates, and report columns) identified by their XML IDs. The NEW statements define new report structures and expressions for tax reports in the Slovenian localization. Dependencies include appropriate access to the Odoo database and modules, and the operations require careful ordering to avoid integrity errors. Input consists of DSL lines; output is the state change in the Odoo system. Limitations include irreversible data deletion and the need for strict environment control during execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_si/17.0.1.1/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

TITLE: Applying Deletions and Creations in Odoo via OpenUpgrade Migration - OpenUpgrade Migration DSL
DESCRIPTION: This series of migration DSL commands is intended to remove outdated or obsolete accounting templates and report expressions, and add new accounting report expressions and report lines in an Odoo module. It assumes the file is processed by the OpenUpgrade framework, where lines starting with 'DEL' indicate a record deletion, and 'NEW' denote the creation of a new record, typically referencing unique XML IDs. The input and output are managed by the OpenUpgrade Odoo tooling and depend on existing record references; incorrect XML IDs or sequence order may result in errors or inconsistent database states.

TITLE: Deleting Odoo Swedish Accounting Configuration Records
DESCRIPTION: Specifies a list of Odoo accounting template records to be deleted using their external IDs. This includes account templates, chart templates, fiscal position templates (accounts and taxes), tax groups, and tax templates, all related to the Swedish localization (l10n_se). The `DEL` command is likely interpreted by the OpenUpgrade tool or a similar mechanism to remove these records from the database. Some records are marked with `(noupdate)`, indicating they were likely flagged not to be updated by standard module updates but are explicitly targeted for deletion here.

TITLE: Deleting Specific l10n_es Account Templates in OpenUpgrade
DESCRIPTION: Specifies a list of `account.account.template` records, identified by their `l10n_es.account_common_XXXX` external IDs, to be deleted using the `DEL` command. This is typically used within an OpenUpgrade migration script (often in YAML format) to remove obsolete or replaced account templates during a system upgrade, specifically targeting the Spanish localization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_es/17.0.5.4/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:

TITLE: Updating HR Leave Accrual Level Model in Python
DESCRIPTION: Modifications to the hr.leave.accrual.level model, including changes to selection fields and new boolean fields.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/hr_holidays/17.0.1.6/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class HrLeaveAccrualLevel(models.Model):
    _name = 'hr.leave.accrual.level'
    
    action_with_unused_accruals = fields.Selection([
        ('all', 'All'),
        ('lost', 'Lost'),
        ('maximum', 'Maximum')
    ])
    added_value_type = fields.Selection([
        ('day', 'Day'),
        ('hour', 'Hour')
    ])
    cap_accrued_time = fields.Boolean(default=False)
    frequency = fields.Selection([
        ('bimonthly', 'Bimonthly'),
        ('biyearly', 'Biyearly'),
        ('daily', 'Daily'),
        ('hourly', 'Hourly'),
        ('monthly', 'Monthly'),
        ('weekly', 'Weekly'),
        ('yearly', 'Yearly')
    ])
```

```

Each line specifies a model and a record identifier to be removed; 'noupdate' flags indicate records not to be recreated by further updates. Requires an interpreter or migration tool that understands this file format. The sequence covers idempotent deletion of accounting structures, with no direct code dependencies but requires Odoo/OpenUpgrade context and data access. Limitations: not portable outside the expected migration context.

DESCRIPTION: This snippet removes various 'account.report.expression' records by their external identifiers, such as 'l10n_do.account_tax_report_itbs_pgdo_imptcn_tag'. It is intended for use within an OpenUpgrade or data migration scenario in Odoo. No direct dependencies are required, but prior knowledge of affected external IDs is necessary. Inputs are the specific record keys to delete, and the output is their removal from the database; limited to the identifiers listed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_do/17.0.2.0/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: pseudo-instructional

DEL account.report.expression: l10n_do.account_tax_report_itbs_retcn_prsn_tag
DEL account.report.expression: l10n_do.account_tax_report_retcn_prsn_tag
DEL account.report.expression: l10n_do.account_tax_report_tbs_11_casilla_formula
```

DESCRIPTION: Explains the transition from a Many2one ('progress_id') relationship to a Many2many ('progress_ids') relationship in the 'onboarding.progress.step' model, linking it to 'onboarding.progress'. The original required 'progress_id' field is deleted. A pre-migration script is necessary to convert the existing relationship data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/onboarding/17.0.1.2/upgrade_analysis_work.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
onboarding   / onboarding.progress.step / progress_id (many2one)        : DEL relation: onboarding.progress, required
onboarding   / onboarding.progress.step / progress_ids (many2many)      : NEW relation: onboarding.progress
# DONE pre-migration: convert from m2o to m2m
```

TITLE: Deleting Odoo Argentinian Tax Templates and UI View Configuration
DESCRIPTION: These commands specify the deletion of multiple Odoo records. They target various Argentinian tax templates (`account.tax.template`) related to IIBB withholding taxes (percepcion sufrida/aplicada for different jurisdictions), IVA withholding taxes, and standard VAT rates for purchases (compras) and sales (ventas). Additionally, it removes a specific user interface view (`ir.ui.view`) related to invoice reports. This is typically part of a data cleanup or migration step in an Odoo update process, specifically for the l10n_ar module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/oca/openupgrade/blob/17.0/openupgrade_scripts/scripts/l10n_ar/17.0.3.6/upgrade_analysis.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_5

```

# NOTHING TO DO: Glitch in the analysis. There's no real change
```

TITLE: Deleting Odoo Account and Tax Templates - Data File - Text
DESCRIPTION: This data snippet provides a series of DELETE (DEL) directives for bulk-removing 'account.group.template' and 'account.tax.template' records by their XML IDs (e.g., l10n_es.account_group_755, l10n_es.account_tax_template_oss_s_iva_ns) in Odoo. There are no code dependencies, but the file must be imported by Odoo's migration framework as part of a module update or OpenUpgrade migration step. Each line follows the format 'DEL <model>: <xml_id>', acts idempotently, and expects the listed records to exist prior to execution. Errors may occur if referenced records have already been deleted or never existed.

These deletions are performed using the 'DEL' command followed by the model name and the external XML ID of the record (e.g., 'l10n_rs.rs_476'). This is typically necessary during database upgrades to remove obsolete, conflicting, or deprecated configuration data.

TITLE: Deleting Account Tax Templates via Migration Scripts - Plain Text
DESCRIPTION: This snippet contains a set of plain text commands prefixed with "DEL" to instruct the OpenUpgrade migration system (or a compatible database migration tool) to delete specific account.tax.template records in Odoo for the l10n_bo localization. These commands are intended to be run as part of a data migration or cleanup step and require context where the 'DEL' instruction is recognized and processed by a migration or data loading framework. Each record is identified by a unique identifier, and this operation is generally irreversible, so it should be performed with caution in production databases.
